metadata.title: CVE-2014-3560 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
NetBIOS name services daemon (nmbd) in Samba 4.0.x before 4.0.21 and 4.1.xbefore 4.1.11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code viaunspecified vectors that modify heap memory, involving a sizeof operationon an incorrect variable in the unstrcpy macro in string_wrappers.h.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
python-samba - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
registry-tools - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba-common - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba-libs - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
smbclient - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.3').
